intro: Erigeron suksdorfii, commonly known as Saksdorf's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron suksdorfii is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
